Sébastien Lecornu's unstoppable rise: From MP assistant to French prime minister

Pig heads left outside several mosques, 'a new and sad milestone in the rise of anti-Muslim hatred'
subhead: Nine pig heads were discovered on Tuesday, September 9, outside as many Muslim places of worship in the Paris region, several of which had the name of the French president written on them. Authorities have launched an investigation.
byline: By Louise Couvelaire and Jérôme Lefilliâtre

title: Polish military slams 'acts of aggression' after Russian drones intruded into its airspace
subhead: The Polish Air Force fired on 'hostile objects' on Wednesday morning after repeated violations of its airspace by Russia. This is the first time a NATO member has taken such action since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: US judge blocks Trump from firing Fed governor, for now
subhead: Donald Trump's move to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook was temporarily blocked by a federal judge on Tuesday as Cook challenges her ouster from the central bank.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Behind the 'Block Everything' movement: Tight budgets and fear about the future
subhead: The surge in inflation in recent years is still being felt, fueling frustration among France's 'just-getting-by' population. Falling unemployment has not stopped the poverty rate from rising.
byline: By Béatrice Madeline and Cécile Prudhomme

Global debt, deficits and inflation put mounting pressure on interest rates
subhead: Accelerated in France by the fall of Prime Minister François Bayrou and his government, the rise in long-term interest rates is affecting most major developed countries.

title: Macron, a vulnerable president after one dissolution and two failed governments
subhead: The fall of Prime Minister François Bayrou ushers in a new period of political instability. The French president, widely seen as responsible for the crisis within his own ranks, now faces pressure from the opposition to propose a new candidate for the post of prime minister.
byline: By Mariama Darame and Nathalie Segaunes

title: Fashion retreats from diversity: 'We are again being openly asked for Caucasian models'
subhead: Until recently, the industry enthusiastically embraced the major social issues stirring society. From supporting Pride to Black Lives Matter, to championing inclusivity in the representation of bodies and identities, fashion seemed in tune with the times. But the tide has turned. The election of Donald Trump, who issued a series of anti-diversity executive orders, has changed everything.
byline: By Sophie Abriat and Valentin Pérez
